thread.title: Namibia: DBN Gets Billions for Power and Fuel Projects
thread.title_full: Namibia: DBN Gets Billions for Power and Fuel Projects

title: Namibia: DBN Gets Billions for Power and Fuel Projects
text:
South Africa: Obituary - Omar Sharif - the Artist of Disappearance 
Asked why DBN has opted for a loan from AfDB and not from local funding institutions, Mutumba said the AfDB is a continental development finance institution which offers suitable financing schemes such as the one offered to DBN. 
"We find the terms of the AfDB line of credit suitable for DBN and Namibia's needs. DBN has come of age and we look forward to making a difference in the socio-economic landscape of Namibia," said Mutumba. 
On Friday, the board of directors of AfDB approved a line of credit amounting to N$4,5 billion to the DBN to finance projects in key priority sectors in the country including infrastructure, manufacturing, logistics and tourism. 
The AfDB said the line of credit will enhance DBN's liquidity and ability to provide financing on appropriate terms to projects and enterprises in key sectors including those with lower levels of economic activity, infrastructure and formerly disadvantaged segments of Namibia's population, particularly women and young entrepreneurs. 
"The financed projects and enterprises are expected to contribute to Namibia's economic development, generate employment opportunities and reduce income inequalities," the bank said. 
The AfDB said in addition the line of credit is expected to contribute to infrastructure development through the provision of support to energy and transport infrastructure initiatives and contribute to private sector development. 
"AfDB's provision of long-term financing is a major boost in the diversification of DBN's funding base because it provides a credible benchmark in terms of size and tenor," the bank said. Namibia
